item.title: Understanding NP
item.description: A decision problem $L$ is a subset of $\{ 0, 1 \}^*$. NP A decision problem $L$ is in $\mathcal{NP}$ if and only if there exists a deterministic polynomial time verifier $V:\{0, 1\}^* \times \{0, 1\}^* \rightarrow \{0, 1\}$ and a polynomial $p$ that satisfies the following conditions: Completeness: For all $x \in L$ there exists a certificate $c \in \{0, 1\}^*$ such that $|c| \leq p(|x|)$ and $V(x,c) = 1$.
